an5.222:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
an5.222:1.3: You don’t achieve the unachieved. What you have achieved falls away. You lose confidence in some things you’ve achieved. You contract a severe illness. You don’t have any friends.
an5.222:1.4: These are the five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
an5.222:2.1: There are these five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.
an5.222:2.3: You achieve the unachieved. What you have achieved doesn’t fall away. You’re confident in some things you’ve achieved. You don’t contract severe illness. You have friends.
an5.222:2.4: These are the five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.”
